text: , also known as ,The name of the shrine is sometimes romanized as Chikuru. is a Japanese Shinto shrine in Miyaki, Saga Prefecture. ==History== Chiriku Hachiman-gū "Hachiman Shinkō," Encyclopedia of Shinto. Retrieved 2012-8-24. was the chief Shinto shrine (ichinomiya) of Hizen Province. It is a chief shrine of Saga Prefecture and Nagasaki Prefecture."Nationwide List of Ichinomiya," p. 3 . Retrieved 2012-8-20. In 1940, the shrine was recognized in the system of State Shinto. It was ranked among the most significant shrines or which included 50 sanctuaries. List of Kankokuheisha (官国幣社), p. 3 . Retrieved 2012-8-24. ==References== ==Other websites== * 千栗八幡宮 at Miyaki Sanpo website Category:Shinto shrines in Saga Prefecture Category:Kokuhei Shōsha Category:Beppyo shrines Category:Ichinomiya Category:Hachiman shrines
title: Chiriku Hachiman-gū
